rules_summary: Keep visuals dynamic; change shot or perspective every few seconds.
Introduce brand proposition early, ideally within first 5 seconds.
Make use of text overlays to reinforce message.
Maintain quick pacing; minimize static visuals.
Engage viewers through high contrast or lively colors.
Use captions to ensure understanding without sound.
Include brand elements early for recognition.
Focus on a single message and avoid clutter.
Adapt music or rhythm to retain engagement.
Ensure visual and text changes every 2-4 seconds to sustain attention.
Avoid complex scenes that require long attention span.
three_three_three_definition: Alter visual elements every 3 seconds to keep engagement high.
Change text overlays or captions to introduce new information every 3 seconds.
Modify rhythm or music intensity every 3 seconds for dynamic flow.
Shift camera angles or zoom level to create a sense of motion.
Engage multiple senses by aligning visual, auditory, and textual shifts.
hook_0_2_rule: Start with a bold, eye-catching visual or action.
Use bright colors or large text to capture immediate focus.
Establish the central theme or problem quickly.
Include a recognizable brand element right at the beginning.
pacing_editing_rules: Keep shots under 5 seconds to maintain rhythm.
Utilize fast cuts to maintain viewer interest.
Transition frequently between scenes or settings every few seconds.
Ensure audio pacing matches video cuts for coherent experience.
Avoid long shots or extensive dialogues that slow pace.
Incorporate quick zooms or pans to maintain a sense of motion.
Echo visual changes with matched audio cues.
Utilize b-roll or cutaways to maintain visual interest.
Combine rapid edits with stable elements to avoid motion sickness.
Ensure no static frame exceeds 3 seconds.
Incorporate animations or text transitions to invigorate stale scenes.
Balance action with brief pauses to prevent fatigue.
Employ rhythmic editing to sync with music beats.
Refresh visuals or context within the impending 3-second window.
